caption:
The photograph captures four people standing outdoors with a panoramic city view in the background. From left to right:

1. An older man with balding hair and wearing a dark suit with a red and blue striped tie.
2. A young woman with long blonde hair, wearing a multi-colored horizontal striped blouse and a white skirt with a red, black, and grey geometric pattern at the hem.
3. A young man with short brown hair, dressed in a light grey suit with a subtle checked pattern, a white shirt, and a red tie.
4. A bald man, appearing to be middle-aged, dressed in a dark suit with a red tie.

The group is standing in a grassy area with wild tall grass and greenery surrounding them. The city skyline in the soft focus background suggests a hilly vantage point overlooking an urban landscape under a clear, sunny sky.
title: Leading air pollution fighters Dr. A.H. Russakoff (left), Ms. Cameron McDonald, Dr. George Hardy, and Dr. Ben V. Branscomb. Dr. Russakoff alerted city to hazards and worked to get smoke emission laws enacted. Ms. McDonald organized the Greater Alliance to Stop Pollution (GASP). Dr. Hardy, the Jefferson County health officer, is responsible for declaring air pollution emergencies. Dr. Branscomb has designed unique oxygen breathing aids for victims of red and black lung disease and emphysema.
